response: The person who is wearing the glasses can receive multiple information, ... but for the other person it's just talk.
[I] don't know what's happening from the other side
The proximity I feel with them correlates with how much freedom they have with the filters.
A bird pooped on me. Now I feel terrible. My appearance isn't great I don't want to be recorded or filtered in any sort of way. It would depend on my feeling for my appearance, for that moment.

behavior.response: Many primary users repositioned themselves to apply the face filters on to the secondary users
Many secondary users found the occasional tapping on the side of AR Glasses eerie because they didn't know how their appearances wer being altered by the primary user

Some of the primary users unintentionally smirked with the application of the face filters on the secondary users because they found them humorous. The secondary users found this interaction distracting.

design.response: Participants noted that they wanted the AR glasses to physically be more transparent to secondary users. Participants discussed about three physical changes: less shaded lenses, visual and auditory indicators, and sharing capabilities for more transparency.

Transparent glasses make participants feel more comfortable because they could see what the other person was focusing on and whether they were reacting to his ideas correctly. Essentially, lighter-colored glasses would provide more transparent communication cues.  Implementing a visible change (i.e. virtual eyes) in the lenses themselves may also be an alternative.
Participants wished for audio or visual indicators to make secondary users aware that AR glasses were in use.

Participants also suggested methods of sharing primary users' content to secondary users. Sharing content would allow secondary users to not only be aware of what primary users are doing, but also feel assured that their appearances were not being nefariously changed. In particular, participants mentioned the use of holograms, projections, and live-streaming capabilities.
